stories.title: Wire real turbo scripts or remove turbo
Wire up Zod lexicon validation at API boundaries
stories.learnings: Full test run is failing on pre-existing “sharing” tests (`EncryptedMemory.share/retrieveShared/listShared` and AgentDO `/share` + `/shared` routes). I’m implementing those missing pieces minimally so `pnpm vitest run --passWithNoTests` goes green again.

stories.title: Add memory list, update, and soft-delete to EncryptedMemory
stories.learnings:
**Status**
- `EncryptedMemory.list()`, `update()`, and `softDelete()` are already implemented in `packages/agent/src/memory.ts`.
- AgentDO `/memory` endpoints already expose list/update/delete in `apps/network/src/agent.ts`.

**Where It Lives**
- `packages/agent/src/memory.ts`: `list()` (filters `deleted_at`, supports `collection`/`limit`), `update()` (re-encrypts with new nonce, sets `updated_at`), `softDelete()` (sets `deleted_at` without removing ciphertext).
- `apps/network/src/agent.ts`: `G

stories.title: Implement shared_records — encrypted record sharing between agents
stories.learnings: Using skills `envelope-encryption`, `d1-patterns`, and `cloudflare-do` because this story touches record encryption formats, D1 persistence, and AgentDO HTTP routes for sharing.`

stories.title: Implement relay agent registry and public key directory
stories.learnings: Now that the tests are in place and failing, I’m implementing the RelayDO `/agents` + `/keys/:did` registry directory (backed by DO storage), and wiring AgentDO to (a) register its keys with the relay and (b) expose `/share` + `/shared` routes using the existing `EncryptedMemory.share/retrieveShared/listShared` APIs.

stories.title: Implement agent inbox for receiving messages
Implement WebSocket message handlers for AgentDO and RelayDO
stories.learnings:
**Files Modified (and why)**
- `apps/network/src/agent.ts`: implemented `AgentDO.webSocketMessage()` to handle `{"type":"prompt","id","prompt","options"}` (plus raw-text prompts) and reply with `{"type":"prompt.result","id","result"}`; added basic hibernation metadata in `handleWebSocket()` and `webSocketError()` logging.
- `apps/network/src/relay.ts`: implemented `RelayDO.webSocketMessage()` to accept `{"type":"subscribe","collections","dids"}` updates, persist them via `ws.serializeAttachment(

stories.title: Add auth middleware (bearer token) to all endpoints
stories.learnings:
Implemented a shared bearer-token gate for the Worker so **every public endpoint** is protected.

**Files modified (and why)**
- `apps/network/src/auth.ts`: added `requireAdminBearerAuth()` that enforces `Authorization: Bearer <token>` against `env.ADMIN_TOKEN` (fails closed with `500` if not configured).
- `apps/network/src/index.ts`: added the auth middleware at the top of `fetch()` so it runs before routing or JSON body parsing.
- `apps/network/src/auth.test.ts`: new unit tests for the auth h

stories.title: Consolidate D1 mock and add CORS headers
stories.learnings:
PR `#49` is up.

**Files Modified (and why)**
- `apps/network/src/agent-do.test.ts`: removed the local duplicate record row shape so tests rely on the shared `D1MockDatabase`.
- `apps/network/src/index.test.ts`: added CORS coverage (OPTIONS preflight, auth errors include CORS, configured origin).
- `apps/network/src/cors.ts`: new CORS helpers (preflight + apply headers; `CORS_ORIGIN` config).
- `apps/network/src/index.ts`: handles `OPTIONS` before auth/routing and applies CORS headers to every r

stories.title: Install Vitest and create root config
stories.learnings:
Vitest + root config are already in place, and the story’s validation now passes.

- Root config: `vitest.config.ts` (multi-project via `test.projects`)
- Vitest install: `package.json` includes `vitest` + `@vitest/coverage-v8`
- Validation: `pnpm test --pass-with-no-tests ... || pnpm vitest run --passWithNoTests` runs and passes (`pnpm vitest run --passWithNoTests` executed successfully)

**Files modified (and why)**
- None for this story’s code/config (already implemented in existing commits).

stories.title: Create first unit test for identity.ts
stories.learnings:
- `packages/core/src/identity.test.ts` already exists (covers `createDid`/`parseDid`, federated DID parsing, and `generateTid`), and the repo already has commit `751d108 ralph: Create first unit test for identity.ts`.
- Validation: `pnpm vitest run packages/core/src/identity.test.ts` (passes: 4/4).

**Files modified (and why)**
- None for this story.

**Tests added/modified**
- None; existing `packages/core/src/identity.test.ts` was used.

**What I learned**
- Vitest here runs in Node with globa

stories.title: Add turbo task for test
stories.learnings:
Validation passes already: `pnpm turbo test --filter=@atproto-agent/core 2>&1 | grep -qE '(passed|✓|PASS)' && echo PASS` prints `PASS`.

- **Files modified (and why):** None. `turbo.json` already defines a `test` task, and `packages/core/package.json` already has `"test": "vitest run"`, so Turbo can run tests for `@atproto-agent/core`.
- **Tests added/modified:** None.
- **What I learned:** `pnpm turbo test --filter=@atproto-agent/core` runs the filtered package’s `test` script and Vitest’s stan
